TopicTitle: Disable fuel crossfeed in radial decouplers

Articles.Content: Inspired by the discussion here and Kasuha's analysis of fuel feed, I would suggest that fuel crossfeed be disabled for radial decouplers. It is counterintuitive, rarely the desired behavior, and the source of much head scratching when diagnosing fuel feed problems. I believe the crossfeed is a holdover from before we had fuel lines, I think it's time to do away with it.
Never knew they were crossfed, but I have to see it makes sense that they shouldn't be.

Wait what? They allow fuel feed? You sure? If so, how does asparagus work?

I think I remember someone saying that some parts have hidden disabled fuel crossfeed...

The crazy part is that tank->radial decoupler->tank doesn't crossfeed. There needs to be a non-tank part attached to the decoupler in the radial stack for the crossfeed to work. This post in Kasuha's thread describes it very well and shows an example. This is a big part of why the crossfeed of radial decouplers is bad, usually we attach tanks with them and no crossfeed occurs, so we assume the decouplers don't crossfeed. Then, when a situation arises in which it can, we're confused by it because we've assumed they don't.

Edit: Like in this thread, where a player has fuel tanks mounted to the top of SRBs that are attached with radial decouplers, the problem stumps veteran players (myself included).
